intro: Ctenodon leptostachyus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed ctenodon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
